page.title: 05INDUSTRY IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: Large scale industry has never been a feature of Kirkby Lonsdale area.In previous centuries a small quantity of {coal}was mined on Casterton Fell. Various{village crafts}were also practised but these too have largely {disappeared.}One remaining today is the village{blacksmith}, and the smithy now thrives under new ownership after the death of Jonty Wilson. Born in 1893 he would captivate his listeners with tales of the days when the blacksmith used to three fires in his smithy and a good blacksmith could deal with{40 horses a day.}In his old age he was much in demand for the quality iron goods he produced.In the 1970's and the 1980's there has been some revival of small village crafts such as{pottery},but these are family or small businesses and have little effect on the{employment situation.
